entities.name: RESERVE BANK OF INDIA
entities.description: The Reserve Bank of India is the central banking institution of India that regulates the country's currency and foreign exchange policies.

entities.name: BANK INDONESIA
entities.description: Bank Indonesia is the central bank of Indonesia responsible for maintaining monetary stability and regulating the financial system.

relationships.relationship_description: Both Reserve Bank of India and Bank Indonesia are central banks of their respective countries, tasked with regulating foreign exchange activities and maintaining monetary stability.
